alert.note: Alert for Central Washington Cascade Foothills; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 13 at 1:45PM PDT until July 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Hot temperatures, Gusty winds and low humidities Sunday and Monday... .Period of hot temperatures, very dry conditions, and gusty winds associated with a dry cold front late this weekend will elevate fire conditions to critical Sunday and Monday. This will increase fire spread for new and exisiting fires. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FOOTHILLS OF CENTRAL WASHINGTON CASCADES, WATERVILLE PLATEAU, WESTERN COLUMBIA BASIN... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FOOTHILLS OF CENTRAL WASHINGTON CASCADES, WATERVILLE PLATEAU, WESTERN COLUMBIA BASIN... The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through late Sunday night. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued from Monday morning through Monday evening. * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 705 Foothills of Central Washington Cascades (Zone 705), Fire Weather Zone 706 Waterville Plateau (Zone 706) and Fire Weather Zone 707 Western Columbia Basin (Zone 707). * Winds: West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidities: 8 to 18 percent in the valleys and 15 to 25 percent over the higher terrain. * Impacts: New and exisiting fires have the potential to spread rapdily within gusty winds and very low humidities.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington Cascade Foothills; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin
